body.p: In addition to the power grounding system, a reference grounding system for high frequency noise is desirable (with the two systems being bonded together for the same reference potential). A grid made up of 2-foot squares will provide an effective signal reference grounding system. The raised floor can be utilized if it has solidly connected metal stringers ensuring good electrical connection. If this type of floor is not available, a grid can be fabricated by laying a mesh (2-foot squares) of braided copper strap directly on the concrete sub floor (electrically connected at each intersection point). The frames of all the data processing equipment, including the STS, should be connected (by the shortest possible distance) to the reference grid with braided copper strap. Finally, the signal reference grid should be bonded to the WaveStar for a single point equipotent ground reference

For optimum performance all distances for power and high frequency grounding should be kept to an absolute minimum. To summarize, a radial grounding system of this type (utilizing a single ground point) will insure that your facility is electrically safe, complies with all code requirements, and will be essentially free of ground caused computer noise and problems.
